reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Scaling Up for Universal Coverage and Impact

description.narrative: South Sudan - Malaria - Population Services International - PSI HQ. This program has the following goals: To reduce malaria morbidity and mortality by 80% of 2013 levels by 2021. To reduce by 50% the 2013 malaria parasite prevalence levels by 2021. The objectives of this program are: To achieve 100% parasitological diagnosis and treatment of all presented malaria cases according to the national guidelines, by 2021. Establish malaria emergency preparedness and ensure timely malaria control responses in all communities affected by conflict, natural disaster or epidemics by 2017. To strengthen and sustain the management and coordination capacity of the malaria programme at all levels, by 2017. Ensure 80% of health facilities routinely report on core malaria indicators by 2016. To increase to at least 80%, community and health worker knowledge, attitudes and practices on malaria prevention and control by 2019. To ensure that 85% of the population at risk are protected by recommended malaria prevention methods, by 2017

title.narrative: SSD-M-PSI Program Agreement 4
SSD-M-PSI Program Agreement
SSD-M-PSI Grant Performance Report
SSD-M-PSI Implementation Letter 1
SSD-M-PSI Implementation Letter 2

SSD-M-PSI Implementation Letter 4

Coverage / Output indicator for SSD-M-PSI
Proportion of facility reports received over the reports expected during the reporting period
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment in the community
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities
Proportion of malaria cases (presumed and confirmed) that received first line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to targeted risk groups through continuous distribution
Proportion of malaria cases (presumed and confirmed) that received first line antimalarial treatment in the community
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to at-risk populations through mass campaigns
Custom: Percentage of CBDs submitting monthly reports during the reporting period (PSI)
Proportion of population at risk potentially covered by long lasting insecticidal nets distributed
Proportion of pregnant women attending antenatal clinics who received three or more doses of intermittent preventive treatment for malaria
M&E-other 1: Percentage of CBDs submitting all monthly reports during the reporting period
Proportion of health facilities without stock-outs of key commodities during the reporting period
Impact indicator for SSD-M-PSI
Confirmed malaria cases (microscopy or RDT): rate per 1000 persons per year
All-cause under-5 mortality rate per 1000 live births
Reported malaria cases (presumed and confirmed)
Malaria parasite prevalence: Proportion of children aged 6-59 months with malaria infection
Malaria test positivity rate
Inpatient malaria deaths per year: rate per 100,000 persons per year
Outcome indicator for SSD-M-PSI
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net for every two people
Proportion of population that slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of women with knowledge on preventive measures against malaria
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net
Proportion of children under five years old who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of pregnant women who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of population with access to an ITN within their household
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net for every two people and/or sprayed by IRS within the last 12 months
Percentage of existing ITNs used the previous night
